Articles.Content:
Ok, new rules for,new people,wishing to join. We ask that you please pm either Voyager275 or myself of your intention to join. Those who have joined already are exempt from this rule. Also, we have decided to pair you off into a 1v1 races.

Also not everyone will be accepted. This is due to the fact that many people would be hard to manage. If you are accepted, then you will get the guidelines for the race sent to you over pm.
I feel like we should fill up the countries, than just go into made up space agency's. And I prefer world space race's, they look the coolest
SpaceplaneAddict has been added to the race

Has he specified the nation/company?

- - - Updated - - -

Gene Tao returned early from his extended coffee break, Seer 2 will launch soon, followed by Seer TS and Seer 4

Has he specified the nation/company?

- - - Updated - - -

Gene Tao returned early from his extended coffee break, Seer 2 will launch soon, followed by Seer TS and Seer 4

Kernadian Space Agency that never was

I feel like we should fill up the countries, than just go into made up space agency's. And I prefer world space race's, they look the coolest

The change is,more because we are thinking long term. I have noticed the thread growing faster than i had expected. In order to better handle the numbers, i thought it would be,best to make the changes i did. Please be,aware, the changes only effect future newcomers.
Oh ok got it

Attention people:

The engineers for our space program have gotten very bored lately. All of the Seer probes are basically copies of each other. Bob Zhu Kerman came up with the idea for commercial launches. If you want a satellite to fly, pm us a craft file for your probe and we'll send it up.

Here is the second group of missions:

http://imgur.com/a/Vz89g

- - - Updated - - -

Here is the only image of Seer 2 which will be released. Reason for failure to achieve orbit classified

We, the Kernadian Space Agency, have, at last, completed our most ambitious project. Behold! The Munar Recon Orbiter! As it orbits now, we are slowly generating a full map of the Mun, with more discoveries to come!

The launch:

The Probe in Low Mun Orbit:
3 space agency's have a kerbal in space, and 1 has it's first probe
Meanie. Listen, we have plans. Infrastructure. For a mission to blow all of you away. It will be soonTM.

Sorry if that was rude, just pointing out the current world missions.

Also made a thread specifically about my space agency: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/136070-Kerbnese-Space-Agency?p=2232594#post2232594

The Artemis 1 in dev:

Also, not to be confused with the Kerbnese's Artimus.
Suggestion: use Canadian Arrow for Manned missions
Ooh, where's that?

Google it, it's pretty cool.

If someone wants to do an international mission, pm me.

- - - Updated - - -

Update: Over half of the Kerbin observatory missions have been canceled to support our interplanetary and manned programs
Dang, I hate it when missions have to be launched without fairings.
As a member od the Kommunist party, I support the Koviets.

The Kerbnese are Kommunist too. And, we all know that the Kerbnese will beat the Koviets to the Mun

- - - Updated - - -

Dang, I hate it when missions have to be launched without fairings.

#bigger rocket

And, we all know that the Kerbnese will beat the Koviets to the Munt

My friend, do not be sure of this.
How about we make this an international effort?

Tread carefully here, folks, we're really close to the roleplaying rule. For clarity:

- Do your mission reports as if you are the space agency of the country rather than its government. After all, KSP is about running a space program rather than advancing a political agenda.

- Try to include more details about the mission itself.

- Do not make reference to the other space program in your reports. It is fine to make mention of your accomplishments during the mission, but there should be no mention of the other side.

- Do not mention ideologies of the nations at all.

Heh, maybe.

Video of the Artemis 1 is coming soon.
Question Red crown: If we create an "international" mission/Kennedy moment, can we refer to the other players?
